sentences.en: He had to cancel some engagements because of tiredness.
sentences.cn: 他太累了，不得不取消一些约会。

sentences.en: He wonders if the different influences might not cancel each other out.
sentences.cn: 他在想，各种影响能不能相互抵消。

sentences.en: Her decision to cancel the concert is bound to disappoint her fans.
sentences.cn: 她决定取消这场音乐会，肯定会使她的歌迷失望。

sentences.en: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.en: I'm sorry, I'll have to cancel lunch today because I'm up to my ears in paper work.
sentences.cn: 很遗憾, 今天我只得不吃午饭了,因为我有很多文书工作要做.

sentences.en: If you cancel your flight, you will forfeit your deposit.
sentences.cn: 乘客取消航班订位，定金概不退还。

sentences.en: In a department store when a gift voucher is exchanged it's stamped with the details of the store to cancel it.
sentences.cn: 在百货公司里，凡是已经兑换的礼券都会在上面盖上将其注销的商店的详细信息。

sentences.en: In this case it is necessary to cancel the party planned for June 16 th.
sentences.cn: 既然如此,那就必须取消原定于6月16日举行的聚会.

sentences.en: It is vitally important to cancel the order immediately.
sentences.cn: 马上取消这批订货是至关重要的.

sentences.en: She made it clear that under no circumstances would she cancel the trip.
sentences.cn: 她明确表示，无论如何她都不会取消旅行。

sentences.en: The band was forced to cancel a string of live dates.
sentences.cn: 乐队被迫取消了一系列的现场表演。

sentences.en: The pros and cons cancel out.
This provided a pretext for the authorities to cancel the elections.
sentences.cn: 这给当局取消此次选举提供了借口。

sentences.en: To cancel the airport would mean a loss of face for the present governor.
sentences.cn: 撤销机场对现任州长来说将是件丢脸的事情。

sentences.en: We'll have to cancel the cricket match, it's raining cats and dogs.
sentences.cn: 雨下得太大了, 我们将只得取消板球比赛了.

sentences.en: You have 14 days in which you can cancel the contract and get your money back.
sentences.cn: 你可在14天之内取消合同，收回钱款。

sentences.en: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
sentences.cn: 你只能打电话给约翰取消了。

trans.tran_en: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen
to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

trans.tran_cn: 取消， 作废； 抵消， 对消； 删去， 划掉
trans.tran_en: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen
